content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-242-02-B |Item_parent=Hyperthyroidism |Item_parent_short=Hyperthyroidism |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the prevalence of hyperthyroidism |Description=None |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors=Dr Camille Buffet,Dr Magalie Haissaguerre |Order=2}} Prevalence is high but varies from country to country (0.2 to 1.9% for all causes combined). Women are more affected than men, with a sex ratio of around 7.

question.title: What is the prevalence of hyperthyroidism?
question.description: The prevalence of hyperthyroidism varies from country to country.

option_d.title: 5 to 10%
option_d.description: A very high prevalence of hyperthyroidism
